step1.sentence: The sign on the fence read: Keep away from the construction zone.

step2.story: Her doctor advised her to keep away from spicy food for at least a month after the surgery. She found it harder to follow than she had expected.

step3.story: The park had a pond where geese gathered every afternoon. A small sign asked visitors to keep away from the nest near the old oak tree. Most people respected it. But one afternoon, a toddler waddled toward the nest before her mother could catch her. A goose spread its wings and honked loudly. The mother scooped up the child and they both backed away very quickly.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어떤 장소나 사람, 것에서 거리를 두다, 가까이 가지 않다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 위험한 곳이나 해로운 것으로부터 멀리 있으라고 할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: keep(유지하다)과 away(멀리)가 결합하여 거리를 유지한다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 경고나 조언의 형태로 자주 씁니다. 사람 또는 장소나 사물 모두에 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Keep away from the edge of the cliff; it is not safe.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 절벽 가장자리에서 멀리 떨어지세요. 안전하지 않아요.
